edu.first.module

Interface Module

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GyroscopeModule, Module.StartardModule, Subsystem

    public interface Module
    A module is the standard for everything that performs some kind of function on the robot. There are three general types of modules:
    • Actuators and Sensors - the base parts of a robot
    • Virtual control - virtual processes that actuate the first group (ex. PID, bang-bang, TBH)
    • Subsystems - groups of modules that perform more useful functions than the actuators and sensors
    This interface creates some basic standards that are upheld across the entire library. It lets classes do whatever they need to, while upholding a general contract of how to behave. Specifically, it allows modules to be enabled and disabled at will. When the user needs the functionality of a module, they can enable it. When they do not need its function, they can disable it. The general contract for all modules is as follows:
    • Modules contain methods specific to their purpose, but do not expose their composed instances for security reasons
    • Modules are "ready" to work when init() has been called, and its functions will work after enable() is called.
    • "Settings" of a module, AKA its internal state, are changeable even when disabled.
    • Between calling enable() and disable(), isEnabled() will return true. Only enable() and disable() can effect the output of isEnabled().
    • If a function is called while the module is disabled, the function should throw a IllegalStateException.
    • Calling any of the methods more than once in a row will not behave differently because of it.
    • The state of isEnabled() should be thread-safe and only return true when it is completely enabled.

    Module.StartardModule is a useful default implementation of Module that fulfills most of the Module contract.

    Since:
    May 22 13
    See Also:
    Module.StartardModule

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Module.StartardModule
      A default implementation of Module that provides a simpler interface for building modules on.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disable()
      Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module cannot be used.
      void enable()
      Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module is operational.
      void init()
      Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module is "ready" to be used.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns the enabled state of the module, indicating whether its functions should work.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
        Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module is "ready" to be used. Whatever is not done in the constructor should be performed here.

      • enable

        void enable()
        Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module is operational. The module's functions should work after this method is called, provided this method did not throw an error.

        The contract for this method is that isEnabled() should return true after this is called until disable() is called. The official enabled state of a module is only technically correct by using isEnabled() and the completion of this method does not by definition mean that the module is enabled. By contract though, completion of this method without error should mean that it is enabled.

      • disable

        void disable()
        Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module cannot be used. The module's functions should not work after this method is called, provided this method did not throw an error.

        The contract for this method is that isEnabled() should return falsee after this is called until enable() is called. The official enabled state of a module is only technically correct by using isEnabled() and the completion of this method does not by definition mean that the module is disabled. By contract though, completion of this method without error should mean that it is disabled.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns the enabled state of the module, indicating whether its functions should work. This method should be thread-safe and only return true if the module is fully enabled.

        When modules are not enabled, their functions (apart from "settings", outlined in this class documentation) will throw an IllegalStateException.

        Returns:
        if module is currently fully functional
